member.name: T:RSA.PaddingProviders.IPaddingProvider
member.summary: Interface which must be implemented by all custom padding providers. Padding is used to provide randomness and unpredictability to the data before it is encrypted.

member.summary: Adds padding to the input data and returns the padded data.

member.summary: Removes padding that was added to the unencrypted data prior to encryption.

member.name: T:RSA.PaddingProviders.OAEP256
member.summary: Uses OAEP Padding Scheme defined in PKCS#1 v 2.1. Uses a SHA256 hash. This padding provider is currently not compatible with .NET's OAEP implementation.

member.name: M:RSA.PaddingProviders.OAEP256.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor. Uses a SHA256 Hash for OAEP hash calculation. This PaddingProvider provides added security to message padding, however it requires the data to be encrypted to be shorter and is not compatible with the RSACryptoServiceProvider's implementation of OAEP.

member.summary: The modulus. This has a value of prime1 * prime2 and is often known as n.

member.summary: Prime number 1, often known as p.

member.summary: Prime number 2, often known as q.

member.name: F:RSA.PrivateKeyBlob.Exponent1
member.summary: Exponent 1. This has a numeric value of d mod (p - 1).

member.name: F:RSA.PrivateKeyBlob.Exponent2
member.summary: Exponent 2. This has a numeric value of d mod (q - 1).

member.name: F:RSA.PrivateKeyBlob.Coefficient
member.summary: Coefficient. This has a numeric value of (inverse of q mod p).

member.name: F:RSA.PrivateKeyBlob.PrivateExponent
member.summary: Private exponent, often known as d.

member.name: T:RSA.RSACrypto
member.summary: RSA Cryptography class

member.name: M:RSA.RSACrypto.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor for the RSA Class. A cipher strength of 1024-bit will used by default. To specify a higher cipher strength, please use the alternate RSACrypto(cipherStrength) constructor.

member.name: M:RSA.RSACrypto.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: RSA Class Constructor
member.param: Cipher strength in bits. 2048 is recommended. Must be a multiple of 8. Max supported by this class is 4096. Minimum is 256. Cipher strength only needs to be specified if generating new key pairs. It is not necessary to know the cipher strength when importing existing key pairs.

member.name: M:RSA.RSACrypto.ToXmlString(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Return the currently loaded key as XML. This method will automatically return an empty string if no key has been loaded.
member.param: Signals whether to include the private key in the output data.
member.returns: XML String with the key data.

member.name: M:RSA.RSACrypto.FromXmlString(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the current class internal variables based on the supplied XML. Attempts to validate the XML prior to setting.
member.param: XML String containing key info

member.name: M:RSA.RSACrypto.ImportParameters(RSA.RSAParameters)
member.summary: Import an existing set of RSA Parameters. If only the public key is to be loaded, Do not set the P, Q, DP, DQ, IQ or D values. If P, Q or D are set, the parameters will automatically be validated for existence of private key.
member.param: RSAParameters object containing key data.

member.name: M:RSA.RSACrypto.ExportParameters
member.summary: Returns an RSAParameters object that contains the key data for the currently loaded key.
member.returns: Instance of the currently loaded RSAParameters object or null if no key is loaded

member.name: M:RSA.RSACrypto.ImportCspBlob(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Imports a blob that represents asymmetric key information.
member.param: A byte array that represents an asymmetric key blob.

member.name: M:RSA.RSACrypto.ExportCspBlob(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Exports a blob that contains the key information associated with an AsymmetricAlgorithm object.
member.param: true to include the private key; otherwise, false.
member.returns: A byte array that contains the key information associated with an AsymmetricAlgorithm object

member.name: M:RSA.RSACrypto.GenerateKeys
member.summary: Generate the RSA Key Pair using the default exponent of 65537.

member.name: M:RSA.RSACrypto.GenerateKeys(System.Int32)
member.summary: Generate the RSA Key Pair using a supplied cipher strength and the default exponent value of 65537. If a cipherStrength was specified in the constructor, the supplied value will override it.
member.param: The strength of the cipher in bits. Must be a multiple of 8 and between 256 and 4096

member.name: M:RSA.RSACrypto.GenerateKeys(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Generate the RSA Key Pair using a supplied cipher strength value and exponent value. A prime number value between 3 and 65537 is recommended for the exponent. Larger exponents can increase security but also increase encryption time. Your supplied exponent may be automatically adjusted to ensure compatibility with the RSA algorithm security requirements. If a cipherStrength was specified in the constructor, the supplied value will override it.
member.param: The strength of the cipher in bits. Must be a multiple of 8 and between 256 and 4096
Custom exponent value to be used for RSA Calculation

member.name: M:RSA.RSACrypto.Encrypt(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encrypt input bytes with the public key. Data can only be decrypted with the private key. If no PaddingProvider is set, the default padding provider of OAEP will be assumed. To specify a different padding algorithm, make sure you set the PaddingProvider property.
member.param: Data bytes to be encrypted
member.remarks: Key generation is CPU intensive. It is highly recommended that you create your key pair in advance and use a predetermined key pair. If you do choose to allow the key pair to be automatically generated, it can be exported to XML or an RSAParameter set after the encryption is complete.

member.name: M:RSA.RSACrypto.EncryptPrivate(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Run the encryption routine using the private key for encryption. While this may be useful in some fringe scenarios, if simple verification is needed it is recommended that you use the Sign() method instead, which signs a hashed version of your data. If no PaddingProvider is set, the default padding provider of OAEP will be assumed. To specify a different padding algorithm, make sure you set the PaddingProvider property.
member.param: Data to be encrypted with the private key

remarks.para: This method uses the PaddingProvider for message verification. To create signature hashes, please use the SignData and VerifyData methods.
Data encrypted this way can be decrypted using your PUBLIC KEY. This method of encryption is meant for verification purposes only and does not secure your data against decryption.

member.name: M:RSA.RSACrypto.SignData(System.Byte[],RSA.SignatureProviders.ISignatureProvider)
member.summary: Sign a hash of the input data using the supplied Signature Provider and encrypt with the private key.
member.param: Data to be hashed and signed
The signature provider to use for signature generation.

member.name: M:RSA.RSACrypto.Decrypt(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Decrypt data that was encrypted using the Public Key. If no PaddingProvider is set, the default padding provider of OAEP will be assumed. To specify a different padding algorithm, make sure you set the PaddingProvider property.
member.param: Encrypted bytes

member.name: M:RSA.RSACrypto.DecryptPublic(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Decrypt data that was encrypted with the Private Key. NOTE: This method uses the PaddingProvider for message decoding. To create signature hashes, please use the SignData and VerifyData methods. If no PaddingProvider is set, the default padding provider of OAEP will be assumed. To specify a different padding algorithm, make sure you set the PaddingProvider property.
member.param: Encrypted bytes

member.name: M:RSA.RSACrypto.VerifyData(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],RSA.SignatureProviders.ISignatureProvider)
member.summary: Verify the signature against the unsigned data. The encryptedData is decrypted using the public key and the unsignedData is hashed and compared to the un-encrypted signed data using the supplied SignatureProvider.
member.param: The raw, unencrypted data to be hashed and compared.
The data that has been hashed and encrypted with the private key.
The signature provider that matches the algorithm used to generate the original signature
member.returns: Boolean representing whether the signature was valid (verified)

member.name: P:RSA.RSACrypto.PaddingProvider
member.summary: Different versions of RSA use different padding schemes. This property allows you to set the padding scheme you wish to use. If not set, the default of OAEP will be used. While PKCS1 v1.5 is supported, OAEP is the recommended padding scheme to use. You can create your own padding schemes by implementing the IPaddingProvider interface.

member.name: P:RSA.RSACrypto.MaxMessageLength
member.summary: Based on the padding provider, messages are stricted to certain lengths for encryption. Also, ensure that the key pair has either been generated or imported.

member.name: E:RSA.RSACrypto.OnKeysGenerated
member.summary: Fires when key generation is complete.

member.name: T:RSA.RSACrypto.KeysGenerated
member.summary: Delegate for OnKeysGenerated event
member.param: Object

member.name: T:RSA.SignatureProviders.ISignatureProvider
member.summary: All custom signature providers must implement this interface. The RSACrypto class handles encryption and decryption of data. The SignatureProvider is intended to provide the hashing and signature generation mechanism used to create the comparison data.

member.returns: Boolean representing whether the input data matches the signed data
